Article Title: Border-Gavaskar Trophy: How Team India can qualify for World Test Championship final
Article Text:
With 15 Tests to go before this cycle ends, there are plenty of permutations and combinations that need to go in

and Co's favour

What India need to do to qualify for World Test Championship final

Scenario 1: If India beat Australia 5-0, 4-1, 4-0 or 3-0

Scenario 2: India beat Australia 3-1

Scenario 3: India beat Australia 3-2

Scenario 4: India draw series 2-2 against Australia

Scenario 5: If India lose the BGT by a 2-3 margin

The comprehensive 295-run victory against Australia in the Perth Test gave India a major boost in their attempt to qualify for the 2025 World Test Championship Final. The result pushed Australia to the second spot on the points table, while India claimed the top position.A couple of days later, the equation changed again with South Africa's emphatic triumph over Sri Lanka at Kingsmead, Durban. The victory saw the Proteas overtake Australia and claim the No. 2 spot, pushing the Aussies to No. 3.Still, there are three months left before the WTC points table is finalised, and the situation is already looking quite fluid.Practically, India, Australia, South Africa, New Zealand and Sri Lanka (the current top 5) are all in the running for the top two spots. While the victory at Perth has brightened India's hopes of going to Lord's which seemed unlikely after the 3-0 home drubbing to New Zealand, Rohit Sharma's men still have a long way to go before they can be assured of a spot in the WTC Final.TOI deconstructs the scenarios in front of India to reach the summit clash for the third successive time.A series win for India by such a comprehensive margin would see Rohit Sharma's men qualify for the final without having to depend on results of other series in the ongoing WTC cycle. Such a scoreline will all but rule out Australia, the current holders of the mace, from the race.If India secure a 3-1 victory versus Australia in the five-match series, they will be able to qualify for the final if South Africa do not beat Sri Lanka in the second Test of their ongoing series.However, a 3-1 series win for India coupled with Sri Lanka suffering a defeat to South Africa in the second Test, would see India drop out. Even a draw between South Africa and Sri Lanka would be enough for India to go through.Such a scoreline would make qualification quite tricky. This means India would need help from the Lankans, who will have to secure at least a draw against Australia in their two-match Test series in Sri Lanka starting January 29.What should serve as an encouragement to the Islanders is the fact that both the Tests are scheduled at Galle, a spin-friendly venue, where Sri Lanka are almost unbeatable. Galle to Sri Lanka is what the Gabba was to Australia before India breached the fortress in 2020-21 and West Indies did it earlier this year.If the Border-Gavaskar series ends 2-2 after five Tests, India's qualification chances reduce further. If that happens though, they would pray for South Africa to beat Sri Lanka 2-0 in the ongoing series and the Lankans beating Australia 1-0.Interestingly, even a 2-3 loss to Australia would still keep India in the hunt for a final berth. But for that, a lot of series results need to go in favour of Rohit Sharma & Co.The ongoing New Zealand-England series needs to finish 1-1, South Africa, the hosts, have to draw both the series vs Sri Lanka and the following series vs Pakistan 1-1 and finally, Sri Lanka vs Australia have to play out a 0-0 draw in the two Tests. At Galle, that seems highly improbable.
Article Summary: India beat Australia by 295 runs in the Perth Test. The result pushed Australia to the second spot on the points table, while India claimed the top position. South Africa's emphatic triumph over Sri Lanka at Kingsmead, Durban, saw the Proteas overtake Australia and claim the No. 2 spot.

Article Title: Advantage India as Australia play a 'wrong card' ahead of Adelaide Test
Article Text:
Photo Source: X

#LIVE: India vs Australia, Pink-Ball Test: Rohit Sharma's batting position, the ideal attack & more

India Playing XI for Adelaide Test: Big selection headaches for India

Australia suffered a huge blow when Josh Hazlewood was ruled out of the pink-ball Test against India in Adelaide , which put the focus on right-arm pacer Scott Boland to replace him for the second Test of the Border Gavaskar Trophy . But India got a good look at Boland with the pink ball in the warm-up fixture at Canberra, which many in Australia believe has put India at an advantage.Boland was named in the Australian Prime Minister's XI squad well before Hazlewood's side strain made him unavailable for the day-night Test in Adelaide. But cricket experts and the Aussie media believe that Cricket Australia could have withdrawn him and not let India warm-up against the 35-year-old seamer.Australian journalist Tom Morris questioned if the CA selectors have done the "right thing".Speaking on SEN radio, Morris said: "Did the Australian selectors do the right thing playing Scott Boland against India? Would it have been better for him and Australia to go into this game with India not having seen him with a pink ball?"Boland has played 10 Tests in his career so far since his debut in the Boxing Day Test of the 2021 Ashes series. But he has been out of the side since the Leeds Test of the Ashes in July last year."I probably expected to play at some stage last summer with seven Tests because of the New Zealand tour as well," Boland was quoted as saying by yahoo.com. "Obviously with those guys (Hazlewood, Pat Cummins and Mitchell Starc) being so resilient, they don't miss too many and no one wants to give up their spot at any stage."They were so dominant last summer, they weren't bowling a heap of overs. We were able to win most of those games, so I probably thought maybe the opportunity had passed. I've worked really hard during the off-season to get my body in a spot where I'm confident that if I get another chance I'll be able to perform for Australia again."Cricket Australia has added fast bowlers Sean Abbott and Brendan Doggett in the squad, but Boland remains the front-runner to replace Hazlewood.
Article Summary: Australia suffered a huge blow when Josh Hazlewood was ruled out of the pink- ball Test against India in Adelaide. Right-arm pacer Scott Boland will replace him for the second Test of the Border Gavaskar Trophy. Cricket experts and the Aussie media believe that Cricket Australia could have withdrawn him and not let India warm-up against the 35-year-old seamer.

Article Title: PV Sindhu to get married: Everything you need to know about her fiancé Venkata Datta Sai
Article Text:
PV Sindhu (Image credit: Instagram)

Who is Venkata Datta Sai?

NEW DELHI: Double Olympic medallist PV Sindhu is set to marry Hyderabad-based Venkata Datta Sai , an executive director at Posidex Technologies, in Udaipur on December 22.The announcement came just days after Sindhu clinched the Syed Modi International title in Lucknow on Sunday.The celebrations will commence on December 20, with a reception planned in Hyderabad on December 24."The two families knew each other but it was only a month ago that everything was finalised. This was the only possible window as her schedule will be hectic from January," Sindhu's father, PV Ramana, told PTI."So that is the reason the two families decided to have the marriage ceremony on December 22. The reception will be held in Hyderabad on December 24. She will start her training soon after as the next season is going to be important," he further added.Venkata Datta Sai serves as an executive director at Posidex Technologies. His father, GT Venkateshwar Rao, holds the position of managing director at Posidex Technologies and previously served in the Indian Revenue Service (IRS).Sai completed his Diploma in Liberal Arts and Sciences from Foundation of Liberal and Management Education.He earned his BBA in Accounting and Finance from Flame University in 2018, followed by a Master's in Data Science and Machine Learning from International Institute of Information Technology, Bangalore.His professional journey includes positions at JSW and as managing director of Sour Apple Asset Management before joining Posidex in December 2019.
Article Summary: Venkata Datta Sai serves as an executive director at Posidex Technologies. Sindhu clinched the Syed Modi International title in Lucknow on Sunday. The celebrations will commence on December 20, with a reception planned in Hyderabad on December 24.

Article Title: Rohit Sharma at No. 5-6 won't be in the best interest of team: Harbhajan Singh
Article Text:
Rohit Sharma (Photo credit: X)

#LIVE: India vs Australia, Pink-Ball Test: Rohit Sharma's batting position, the ideal attack & more

NEW DELHI: Former Indian off-spinner Harbhajan Singh believes skipper Rohit Sharma will feature in the top order during the second day-night Test against Australia, starting December 6 in Adelaide.Harbhajan expects Rohit to either open the innings or bat at number three, ruling out the possibility of the 37-year-old playing lower down the order in the pink-ball encounter.Rohit missed the first Test of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy in Perth, where KL Rahul and Yashasvi Jaiswal delivered a stunning 201-run opening partnership in the second innings. Their exceptional stand propelled India to a commanding 295-run victory.In the recently concluded warm-up game ahead of the day-night Test, Rohit came in at No.4 against Australia Prime Minister's XI that left everyone guessing about Rohit's batting slot for the second Test."I don't see Rohit coming in at number five or six. Either Rohit will open with Yashasvi Jaiswal, with KL Rahul coming in at number three, or he will bat no later than number three," Harbhajan told PTI."Number six for Rohit wouldn't be in best interest of the team. Your top four in batting order should be the four pillars and someone like Rohit at the top would only add greater fillip."Harbhajan also commented on the selection of Washington Sundar over Ravichandran Ashwin and Ravindra Jadeja in the first Test. He considered it a significant decision."Washington had showed during the New Zealand series that he is ready to take over the mantle from Ashwin in coming days," the 'Turbanator' said.Addressing Ashwin's age as a potential factor, Harbhajan offered his perspective."I don't think 38 is old. He is not a 58- year-old. But yes, after so many years, the shoulders do experience fatigue and wear and tear, so the zip can just be a bit less."On the drama surrounding the upcoming ICC Champions Trophy, Harbhajan urged the Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) to accept the 'Hybrid Model' which proposes that India play its matches in Dubai."Ask all players, they would say they are ready to play in Abu Dhabi or Dubai. In any case, we don't see too many Indo-Pak games as such, and Pakistan should keep their ego aside and agree to the 'Hybrid Model'."There is a security concern (for India) and I have been saying this since 2022," he added.
Article Summary: Harbhajan Singh believes skipper Rohit Sharma will feature in the top order during the second day-night Test against Australia. The 37-year-old missed the first Test of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy in Perth, where KL Rahul and Yashasvi Jaiswal delivered a stunning 201-run opening partnership in the second innings.

Article Title: Gautam Gambhir heads back to Australia, to reunite with team on Tuesday
Article Text:
Team India head coach Gautam Gambhir (Getty Images)

#LIVE: India vs Australia, Pink-Ball Test: Rohit Sharma's batting position, the ideal attack & more

NEW DELHI: Team India head coach Gautam Gambhir is set to rejoin the squad in Australia on Tuesday, ahead of the second Test at Adelaide Oval, scheduled to begin on December 6. Gambhir had briefly returned to India for personal reasons following the team's commanding win in the first Test in Perth.In his absence, India played a two-day warm-up match against the Prime Minister's XI at Manuka Oval in Canberra. The game was curtailed to a 46-overs-a-side contest due to bad weather.Gambhir had left Australia on 26th November 26th after the conclusion of the Perth Test where India secured a commanding 295-run win.The second Test match of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy begins on Friday which will be day-night affair.One of Gambhir's first tasks upon returning will be to finalize the playing XI for the Adelaide Test.Team's captain, Rohit Sharma also earlier joined the squad in Australia after missing the first Test due to the birth of his second child.In Gambhir's absence, coaching responsibilities were handled by Abhishek Nayar, Ryan ten Doeschate, and Morne Morkel. They oversaw the team's training and preparations for the warm-up match, which India won by six wickets.Jasprit Bumrah captained the Indian team in Rohit's absence during the Perth Test.Rohit's return and Shubman Gill's strong performance in the warm-up game present selection challenges for Gambhir.Gill scored a half-century against the Prime Minister's XI after missing the first Test due to a fractured right thumb.The Indian team arrived in Adelaide from Canberra on Monday afternoon.India have scheduled three practice sessions before the second Test, including two under lights on Tuesday and Thursday.
Article Summary: Team India head coach Gautam Gambhir is set to rejoin the squad in Australia on Tuesday. Article Title: Is Ding Liren looking to stretch the world chess championship match to tie-breaks? Gukesh looks set to take risks
Article Text:
D Gukesh

NAGPUR: Is Ding Liren trying to repeat the script of his 2023 world championship title by stretching his match against the challenger, D Gukesh , to the tie-breaks?In a battle of strategy and nerves at the World Chess Championship in Singapore, the reigning champion appears to be biding his time, relying on patience and calculated defense to stretch his match against the 18-year-old Gukesh into tie-breaks -- a format where Ding thrives.On his way to become the world champion last year, Ding defeated Ian Nepomniachtchi in the tie-breaks -- matches in faster time control. In the shorter format, Ding is world No. 2, and Gukesh has a lowly 46th rank as per FIDE rapid ratings. In the classical format, Gukesh is world No. 5, while Ding is at the 22nd rank.While Ding seems to prefer cautious play, the youngest-ever challenger to a world title has electrified the championship with his bold, risk-taking approach. The way the challenger refused to accept the draw by repetition and chose to gamble in the crucial sixth round shows that Gukesh aims to close the championship in the classical format.Gukesh’s approach impressed world No.1 Magnus Carlsen , who suggested on Take Take Take that he wants Gukesh to take more risks which will put pressure on Ding forcing him to make a mistake. “Had Gukesh played King G7 on the 37th turn (instead of moving his rook), he would have won the game,” he pointed out during the Game 6 recap.When Gukesh refused to accept a draw in the sixth game, most of the computer engines thought the game would turn Ding’s way but the Indian GM thought otherwise. On Monday, when Carlsen analysed the round-6, he explained how Gukesh with black pieces could have put pressure on Ding and had a chance of winning the game as the Indian GM had active pawns.Of six games played so far, the crucial sixth round was the longest where Gukesh stretched it to 46 moves and 4 hours, 35 minutes. Gukesh and Ding have won a game each and drawn four rounds to remain at par in the championship with three points each, both are 4.5 points away from winning the title.All the four games that ended in a draw by repetition, the 32-year-old Ding was the one who initiated the action to repeat the moves.The dramatic sixth round gave the impression that Gukesh will be the one who will end the deadlock of drawn games in the championship when he didn’t accept a draw through three-fold repetition on the 26th move and eventually split the points on the 46th turn.In the fifth round, which lasted for 40 moves, Ding, with the black pieces, initiated the repetition process from the 34th turn. The game was heading towards threefold repetition, and both players agreed to split the points on the 40th move.In the fourth round, Ding had the opening advantage with the white pieces, but the Chinese GM started repeating the moves from the 38th turn and drew the game on the 42nd move.Similarly, in the second round, Ding, with the white pieces, initiated the process from the 19th turn, and after threefold repetition, the game ended in a 23-move draw. While Ding defeated Gukesh in the opening round, the Indian challenger brought parity by winning the third game.Being the youngest challenger to any world champion, Gukesh is ambitiously making his moves on the board while Ding has not been at his aggressive best. After he tried to repeat his Game 6 opening of the last year’s world championship against Nepo which Gukesh didn’t allow on Sunday, Ding in the post-game conference said, “Last time too, in Game Six, I won a beautiful game in London, so this time I wanted to repeat that success.” The hint is clear that the Chinese will come up with more repetition in the remaining eight games with an intention to stretch the match to tie-breaks.With six games played and both players locked at three points each, the clash is shaping up as a duel of contrasting philosophies, with Gukesh pushing to settle the score in the classical format and Ding seemingly eyeing rapid play to retain his crown.
Article Summary: Ding Liren and D Gukesh are locked at three points each in the World Chess Championship. The match is being played in the classical format, with both GMs at 22nd rank. The youngest-ever challenger to a world title has electrified the championship with his bold, risk-taking approach.

Article Title: Physically Disabled Challengers Trophy 2024: Team-Seniors to clash with India-A in final
Article Text:
Players in action during the third day of the Physically Disabled Challengers Trophy match in Jaipur on Monday.

Jaipur: Team India-Seniors will clash with Team India-A in the final of the Physically Disabled Challengers Trophy 2024 at the Jaipuria Cricket Academy here on Tuesday.In the final league matches played on Monday, Team India-Seniors thumped India-B, while India-A prevailed over India-C to seal their place in the summit clash.Batting first, India-A amassed a huge score of 173 for 7 which helped them oust India-C by 46 runs. India-A captain Ravindra Sante led from the front with a 56-run knock off 36 balls and was awarded the ‘player-of-the-match’.In the second match of the day, India-Seniors trounced India-B by 7 wickets. India-B were restricted to 144/4 in their allotted 20 overs.While chasing the modest target, both the openers of India-Seniors -- Surendra Kumar and Prasad Chavan -- batted brilliantly and gave the team a strong start. While Surendra contributed 34 off 25, Chavan struck 44-ball 49. For his match-winning knock, Chavan was named ‘player-of-the-match.The final will begin at 10 am on Tuesday on International Day of Persons with Disabilities.The tournament is being organised at Jaipuria Cricket Academy, Jaipur in association with RajasthanDisabled Cricket Association (RDCA) in collaboration with Petroleum Sports Promotion Board and State Bank of India.Encouraging all the players, Kanhaiya Lal Choudhary, Minister of PHED Department, Government of Rajasthan said that this tournament is proving to be a game changer for the society. He also congratulated all the differently abled cricketers for their bright future.
Article Summary: Team India-Seniors will clash with Team India-A in the final of the Physically Disabled Challengers Trophy 2024 at the Jaipuria Cricket Academy. The final will begin at 10 am on Tuesday on International Day of Persons with Disabilities.

Article Title: Arrested over corruption charges, ex-South African Test cricketers Thami Tsolekile, Lonwabo Tsotsobe face imprisonment
Article Text:
Representational image (PTI Photo)

ALSO WATCH

#LIVE: India vs Australia, Pink-Ball Test: Rohit Sharma's batting position, the ideal attack & more

South Africa 's former Test players Thami Tsolekile and Lonwabo Tsotsobe face legal proceedings following their arrest on corruption charges linked to match-fixing allegations, with potential imprisonment if found guilty.Ethy Mbhalati, a domestic player, was taken into custody last month and faces corruption allegations along with Tsolekile and Tsotsobe.Tsolekile and Tsotsobe had previously received extensive cricket bans alongside other players. The pair appeared before a specialised commercial crimes court in Pretoria on Friday, where they received five charges under the country's anti-corruption legislation.Under South African anti-corruption laws, offenders may receive up to 18-year prison terms in certain cases. However, two other players previously involved in the same scandal received suspended sentences after entering guilty pleas.Tsolekile and Tsotsobe were apprehended in March regarding a 2015 domestic tournament match-fixing case in South Africa. A special police unit had been investigating the two players since 2016.The 2015 Ram Slam T20 tournament investigation revealed that Gulam Bodi, a former South African international batsman, approached players to manipulate matches or specific aspects of games on behalf of Indian bookmakers. Subsequently, Bodi received a five-year prison sentence for his attempts to orchestrate match-fixing.The investigation team concluded that whilst players had discussions about potential match-fixing, no actual manipulation took place.Two other players were handed suspended prison sentences after pleading guilty following their arrest in 2021 and 2022.The 44-year-old Tsolekile, a right-handed batter, has played three Tests. In 2016, he received a 12-year cricket ban. Tsotsobe, 40, is a former fast bowler who represented South Africa across all formats between 2009 and 2014. He received an eight-year suspension in 2017.
Article Summary: Former Test players Thami Tsolekile and Lonwabo Tsotsobe face corruption charges linked to match-fixing allegations. The pair appeared before a specialised commercial crimes court in Pretoria on Friday, where they received five charges. Under South African anti-corruption laws, offenders may receive up to 18-year prison terms in certain cases.

Article Title: BAN vs WI 2nd Test: Nahid Rana gives Bangladesh control against West Indies on Day 3
Article Text:
Bangladesh pacer Nahid Rana (Photo Source: X)

After Bangladesh pacer Nahid Rana's five-wicket spell triggered West Indies ' collapse on day three of the second Test, the visitors' batting line-up fought it out to take control of the match in Jamaica .The Windies, who began the day at 70 for 1, were just 94 runs away from Bangladesh's first-innings total of 164 but had no answer to the skills of 22-year-old Rana who took 5 for 61 as the home team was bowled out for 146 to concede a thin 18-run lead.Keacy Carty led the Windies' scorecard with his knock of 40, while skipper Kraigg Brathwaite, who was caught at gully off Rana's bowling as the first wicket of the day, managed 39 runs.Rana's fellow pacer Hasan Mahmud took 2 for 19, while Taskin Ahmed, Tajiul Islam and captain Mehidy Hasan Miraz took one wicket each.After that the Bangladesh batting line-up, encouraged by their bowling success, came up with a better effort in the second innings to reach 193 for five at stumps, extending their lead to 211 with five wickets remaining.Bangladesh recovered from the early dismissal of Mahmudul Hasan Joy (0) with 46 from Shadman Islam and a brisk 39-ball 42 from captain Miraz, who elevated himself to number four in the batting order.Considering that the highest successful Test chase at Sabina Park stands at 211, accomplished by the West Indies against Sri Lanka in 2003, historical statistics suggest Bangladesh are well-positioned to secure a series-levelling victory in the remaining two days.
Article Summary: Nahid Rana's five-wicket spell triggered West Indies collapse. Windies bowled out for 146 to concede a thin 18-run lead. Bangladesh batting line-up came up with a better effort in the second innings to reach 193 for five at stumps.

Article Title: 'Team not looking at past records': Ex-India selector on Ashwin, Jadeja omissions
Article Text:
Ravindra Jadeja and Ravichandran Ashwin. (PTI Photo)

Selection dilemma for India ahead of Adelaide Test

#LIVE: India vs Australia, Pink-Ball Test: Rohit Sharma's batting position, the ideal attack & more

NEW DELHI: The recent omissions of seasoned players Ravichandran Ashwin and Ravindra Jadeja from the first Test of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy have sparked widespread discussion.Former India selector Devang Gandhi has come forward to shed light on the reasoning behind these decisions, emphasising that the team management's focus is firmly on current strategies rather than past records considering the factor when one plays in Australia or England."I do feel that the current form has been taken into consideration. The Indian team management wanted to go in with a team that had confidence and not exactly looking at the past records," said Gandhi while talking to news agency PTI.With 536 Test wickets to his name, Ashwin stands as a genuine cricket legend, yet his immediate prospects appear uncertain in the ongoing Border-Gavaskar Trophy. His inclusion in the playing squad might only materialise if any of the forthcoming four pitches necessitate deploying two spin bowlers.Should the pitches continue to favour pace and bounce, as witnessed in Perth, the 38-year-old spinner faces a significant challenge in securing his spot in the playing eleven. This situation could change only if the team's preferred choice, Washington Sundar , delivers poor performances.Even in such circumstances, Jadeja, who possesses better batting statistics in SENA (South Africa, England, New Zealand, Australia) nations, is likely to be preferred over the Chennai-based spinner."Washy bowled well against New Zealand and is a reliable lower middle-order batter. So it does make sense," Gandhi, who was the selector from 2016-17 to 2020-21, said.The bowling lineup is expected to remain unchanged for the Pink Ball Test in Perth, following the established pattern.It's worth noting that Ashwin's finest bowling performance in Australia and SENA nations occurred during the December 2021 Day/Night Test at Adelaide, where he claimed impressive figures of 4/55 in the only Australian innings.However, Ashwin's recent performance in the home series against New Zealand, where he managed just nine wickets despite two matches being played on spin-friendly tracks, makes it challenging for him to secure a spot in the current playing eleven."In Australian conditions, you want a restrictive option. This is not to say that Washy can't be attacking but India's bowling game plan will revolve around Jasprit Bumrah , Mohammed Siraj and Harshit Rana. If Mohammed Shami is included at later stages then he too. So a spinner's job will be to give respite to these speed merchants and bowl one line," Gandhi said."Also you need to be a steady batter. He did well in Brisbane last series and also looked good in Perth during the second essay. He batted well in Canberra. He is going to be the first choice," Gandhi added.The primary challenge for Ashwin lies in his inability to secure even one five-wicket haul while playing in SENA nations.His statistics in SENA countries show 71 wickets across 43 completed innings. His finest bowling performance stands at 4 for 55, while requiring 83.7 balls on average (approximately 14 overs) to claim each wicket.In comparison, Jadeja has claimed 52 wickets in 35 completed innings, including one five-wicket haul (6/138) achieved in 2014. His bowling efficiency mirrors Ashwin's at 83.7 balls (14 overs per wicket).Jadeja's preference in team selection has largely stemmed from his superior batting performances in these nations, boasting five half-centuries and one century, maintaining an average close to 30. In contrast, Ashwin has registered only two half-centuries.Their joint inclusion appears likely only at Sydney, contingent upon Washington's fitness and the pitch conditions. However, should conditions favour two spinners, the team management might opt for Jadeja ahead of Ashwin.
Article Summary: Ravichandran Ashwin and Ravindra Jadeja were left out of India's squad for the first Test of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy. Former India selector Devang Gandhi has shed light on the reasoning behind these decisions. Gandhi says the team management's focus is firmly on current strategies rather than past records.

Article Title: Wicket celebration gone wrong! Bowler horribly twists ankle, shouldered off the field. Watch
Article Text:
(Photo credit: Screengrab from video posted on X)

NEW DELHI: In an unfortunate turn of events, Nepal's spinner Yuvraj Khatri suffered an ugly injury after his wicket celebration went horribly wrong during the Under-19 Asia Cup clash against Bangladesh in Dubai on Sunday.Yuvraj badly twisted his ankle while celebrating the fall of Bangladesh wicket and had to be shouldered off the field.The incident took place in the 28th over of the Bangladesh chase when Yuvraj trapped Md Rizan Hossan in front of the stumps for a golden duck.As soon as the on-field umpire raised his finger after Nepal's appeal, Yuvraj took off for a sprint celebration, leaving behind his teammates.But then, towards the end of the celebratory jump, he badly landed on his ankle, twisting it and fell down in agonizing pain. Yuvraj's worried teammates then gathered around him as he held on to his painful left ankle. Yuvraj eventually had to leave the field on the back of his teammate's shoulder and did not return to bowl.In the six overs that Yuvraj bowled before his injury, he took four wickets, conceding just 23 runs.Earlier, Yuvraj had also given another Bangladesh batter a shoe-call send-off.Chasing 142 for victory, Bangladesh U19 eventually won the match by 5 wickets.
Article Summary: Nepal's spinner Yuvraj Khatri suffered an ugly injury after his wicket celebration went horribly wrong during the Under-19 Asia Cup clash against Bangladesh in Dubai on Sunday. He badly twisted his ankle while celebrating the fall of Bangladesh wicket. Chasing 142 for victory, Bangladesh U19 won the match by 5 wickets.

: Mehidy Hasan Miraz (Captain), Litton Das (WK), Tanzid Hasan Tamim, Soumya Sarkar, Parvez Hossain Emon, Md Mahmudullah, Jaker Ali Anik, Afif Hossain Dhrubo, Rishad Hossain, Nasum Ahmed, Taskin Ahmed, Hasan Mahmud, Shoriful Islam, Tanzim Hasan Sakib, Nahid Rana.

NEW DELHI: Mehidy Hasan Miraz has been named Bangladesh’s captain for the upcoming West Indies ODIs , following the absence of regular captain Najmul Hossain Shanto .Mehidy will captain Bangladesh for the first time in ODIs, as Shanto is still recovering from a groin injury, the Bangladesh Cricket Board (BCB) announced.The three-match ODI series against West Indies is scheduled to start on December 8 in Saint Kitts.Middle-order batter Towhid Hridoy has also been declared unavailable by the BCB’s medical team due to ongoing groin issues.“Hridoy had complained of pain in his right groin region and subsequent investigations have confirmed the presence of a medical condition. He has been advised rest and we will reassess him in two weeks to determine his readiness to play," BCB's Sports Physician Monzur Hossain Chowdhury said in a statement.Experienced all-rounder Shakib Al Hasan was absent from the squad following his non-participation in both the farewell Test series against South Africa and the home ODI series versus Afghanistan.The ODI squad saw the return of wicketkeeper-batter Litton Das, alongside Parvez Hossain Emon, Hasan Mahmud and Tanzim Hasan Sakib. Notably, Parvez's previous selection was in 2021 against West Indies, though he remained unused throughout that series.Left-handed batsman Afif Hossain Dhrubo has earned a recall to the ODI squad after a year's absence. His last ODI appearance for Bangladesh was in December 2023.Fast bowler Mustafizur Rahman opted out of the tour to stay with his wife, who is expecting their first child in December.
Article Summary: Mehidy Hasan Miraz named Bangladesh's captain for ODI series against West Indies. Regular captain Najmul Hossain Shanto is still recovering from a groin injury. Middle-order batter Towhid Hridoy also declared unavailable by the BCB’s medical team.

Article Title: 'Nah nah, I’m ...': Mitchell Marsh on his availability for pink-ball Test
Article Text:
Mitchell Marsh. (Cricket Australia Photo)

Who could replace Rohit Sharma as Team India's captain in Tests?

NEW DELHI: Australian all-rounder Mitchell Marsh addressed questions about his availability for the upcoming pink-ball Test , downplaying speculation with a touch of humour.Marsh experienced soreness after bowling 19.3 overs in the Perth Test, where Australia suffered a 295-run defeat to India.With the pink-ball Test posing unique challenges, Marsh’s fitness and form will be crucial as Australia seek to bounce back from their defeat in the series opener."The body’s all good, yep. Nah nah, I’m good to go. Yep, I’ll be there,” said Marsh in a conversation with Channel Nine after arriving in Adelaide.Since his return to the Test team with a century at Leeds during last year’s Ashes, Marsh has scored 803 runs in 11 matches at an impressive average of 44.61.As a result, Australia included uncapped all-rounder Beau Webster in the squad as cover for Marsh. Webster was seen practicing alongside Usman Khawaja, Nathan McSweeney, Steve Smith, Travis Head, and Alex Carey at the Adelaide Oval nets.Should Marsh retain his position in the playing eleven for the Adelaide Test, Australia will need to choose between Webster and Scott Boland as a replacement for the injured Josh Hazlewood Australia boast an impressive record at Adelaide, having won their last five Tests there, with their most recent defeat occurring against India in 2018/19. Additionally, they maintain a perfect record of seven victories in seven day-night Tests at this venue.However, Australia's unblemished record in day-night Tests came to an end in January 2024 at Brisbane, where West Indies secured an eight-run victory, breaking Australia's streak of 11 consecutive wins in this format.India, meanwhile, hold a strong record in day-night Tests, winning three out of their four matches. Their most recent day-night Test resulted in a victory against Sri Lanka in Bengaluru in March 2022. Their sole defeat in this format came against Australia at Adelaide Oval in December 2020, where Hazlewood's remarkable figures of 5-8 dismissed India for 36 in their second innings.
Article Summary: Mitchell Marsh says he is 'good to go' for Australia's pink-ball Test against India. Marsh experienced soreness after bowling 19.3 overs in the Perth Test. Australia included uncapped all-rounder Beau Webster in the squad as cover for Marsh.

Article Title: Ton-up Mohamed Amaan sets up India's first win at Under-19 Asia Cup
Article Text:
(Photo credit: ACC)

NEW DELHI: Middle-order batter Mohamed Amaan struck an unbeaten 118-ball 122 as India thrashed minnow Japan by a massive 211 runs to register their first Under-19 Asia Cup win in Sharjah on Monday.After Amaan's solid century propelled India to a commanding 339 for six, a clueless Japan were stopped at 128 for 8 as India gained two crucial points and boosted their NRR to +1.680 in the group.After Japan opted to bowl, Amaan anchored the India with a composed ton that included seven boundaries. Alongside Amaan, opener Ayush Mhatre and middle-order KP Karthikeya provided valuable support with half-centuries.After Mhatre's explosive 29-ball 54 (six fours and four sixes) laid a solid platform, Karthikeya contributed a brisk 57 off 49 balls, hitting five fours and a six alongside Amaan ton.Further contributions from C Andre Siddarth (38), Hardik Raj (25 not out), and Vaibhav Suryavanshi (23) powered India to an imposing total.For Japan, Hugo Kelly and Kiefer Yamamoto-Lake each claimed two wickets.In the tall chase, Japan never gained momentum and looked in control, losing wickets at regular intervals.For the Japanese, Hugo Kelly (50) was the top-scorer while Charles Hinze remained unbeaten on 35.Karthikeya (2/21), Hardik Raj (2/9), and Chetan Sharma (2/14) were the pick of the Indian bowlers.However, despite the substantial victory margin, India remains at the third spot in the group, below Pakistan and United Arab Emirates.Earlier, India had suffered a 43-run defeat against arch-rivals Pakistan in their opening match. India next face the UAE in their final group stage match on Wednesday. The top two teams from each group will advance to the semifinals on December 6.The final is scheduled for December 8.
Article Summary: India thrash minnow Japan by 211 runs to register their first Under-19 Asia Cup win. Middle-order batter Mohamed Amaan struck an unbeaten 118-ball 122 as India thrashed Japan by a massive 211 runs. India gained two crucial points and boosted their NRR to +1.680 in the group.

Article Title: Rohit Sharma welcomed by 'Mumbai Cha Raja' chant as Team India captain takes the field - WATCH
Article Text:
Rohit Sharma (Getty Images)

WATCH:

#LIVE: India vs Australia: Rohit Sharma returns, Gill looks good in the nets but who bats where?

NEW DELHI: India captain Rohit Sharma received a warm welcome from a fan on day two of the pink-ball warm-up match against the Prime Minister's XI at the Manuka Oval in Canberra.In a video that surfaced on social media, the fan chanted " Mumbai cha Raja , Rohit Sharma" as the Indian captain made his way onto the field.Rohit had missed the opening Test in Perth due to paternity leave, following the birth of his baby boy with wife Ritika Sajdeh .After his team's victory in the warm-up match, Rohit expressed satisfaction with their performance, stating that they had achieved their objectives as a unit.A four-wicket haul by pacer Harshit Rana, along with commanding knocks from Shubman Gill , Nitish Kumar Reddy, and Yashasvi Jaiswal , helped India secure a five-wicket win against Australia's Prime Minister's XI at Canberra's Manuka Oval on Sunday.Speaking at the post-match presentation, Rohit also expressed gratitude towards the crowd for their support."It was fantastic (the match and the win). We got what we wanted as a group. It was a bit unfortunate that we couldn't play the entire game, but we made the most of the time we had. Absolutely fantastic (to see the crowd). We love coming to Australia, and it's always great to see fans turn up to support us. There's never been a time when they haven't shown up. It's really nice to see people coming out and cheering for us," he said.After taking part in the two-day warm-up match, Rohit and his team departed Canberra for the Adelaide Test, which will begin on December 6.India defeated Australia by 295 runs in Perth to take a 1-0 lead in the five-match series.
Article Summary: Rohit Sharma received a warm welcome from a fan on day two of the pink-ball warm-up match against the Prime Minister's XI in Canberra. The fan chanted " Mumbai cha Raja, Rohit Sharma" as the Indian captain made his way onto the field. Rohit had missed the opening Test in Perth due to paternity leave, following the birth of his baby boy.

Article Title: 56 killed in stampede due to clashes at soccer match in Guinea
Article Text:
(Pic Credit - X)

NEW DELHI: A tragic stampede at a football stadium in southern Guinea resulted in 56 fatalities and numerous injuries following fan clashes, as announced by the Guinean government on Monday.The government has initiated an investigation to identify those responsible for the Sunday incident, according to Communications Minister Fana Soumah 's televised statement.Local media and political groups reported that children were among those who lost their lives, reported news agency AP.The incident occurred on Sunday afternoon at Nzerekore stadium during a local tournament final between Labe and Nzerekore teams, organised to honour military leader Mamadi Doumbouya , as stated by Prime Minister Amadou Oury Bah on X.Bah confirmed casualties without providing specifics, noting that regional authorities were working to stabilise the situation.According to local reports, security forces deployed tear gas to control the chaos that erupted after a contested penalty decision.Media Guinea reported that the disputed penalty sparked supporter outrage, leading to stone-throwing and subsequent tear gas deployment by security forces. The outlet noted that children were among the deceased, with several critically injured victims receiving treatment at a regional hospital.Video footage from the venue showed supporters protesting referee decisions before conflicts erupted, with spectators spilling onto the pitch.The recordings captured people fleeing the stadium, with many scaling the high perimeter fence.Additional footage showed numerous casualties on a hospital floor surrounded by people providing assistance to the wounded.The National Alliance for Alternation and Democracy opposition group demanded an inquiry, criticising the tournament as a vehicle for promoting the military leader's "illegal and inappropriate" political aspirations.Guinea has been under military governance since the 2021 coup that removed President Alpha Conde. It joins other West African nations, including Mali, Niger and Burkina Faso, where military takeovers have delayed civilian rule restoration.Doumbouya, who led the coup three years ago, claimed to prevent national chaos and criticised the previous administration's unfulfilled promises, though he faces criticism for not meeting public expectations.
Article Summary: A tragic stampede at a football stadium in southern Guinea resulted in 56 fatalities and numerous injuries. The government has initiated an investigation to identify those responsible for the Sunday incident. The incident occurred on Sunday afternoon during a local tournament final between Labe and Nzerekore teams, organised to honour military leader Mamadi Doumbouya.

Article Title: Fiorentina's Edoardo Bove collapses on field, stable - WATCH
Article Text:
File image of Edoardo Bove (Photo Source: X)

Fiorentina 's Serie A match against Inter Milan on Sunday witnessed distressing scenes when their player Edoardo Bove collapsed on the field and was rushed to a hospital where he was examined and found to have no "severe damage".The 22-year-old player remains in stable condition, while the match has been suspended and will be played at a later date that will be decided soon. The incident happened 16 minutes into the match, with no goal scored yet by either team."Initial cardiological and neurological tests have ruled out severe damage to his central nervous and the cardio-respiratory systems," said Fiorentina in a joint statement with Florence's Careggi Hospital.He is currently in the intensive care unit of the hospital and under sedation. The club said that a re-assessment of his condition will be done "in the next 24 hours".The collapse of Bove brought back painful memories for supporters of the late skipper Davide Astori, who passed away unexpectedly whilst sleeping at age 31 in March 2018, prior to an away fixture at Udinese.On social platforms, goalkeeper David de Gea wrote "God please", whilst several clubs, including his parent club Roma who had loaned him to Fiorentina in August, expressed their solidarity.
Article Summary: Fiorentina's Edoardo Bove collapsed on the field during their Serie A match against Inter Milan on Sunday. The 22-year-old player remains in stable condition. The match has been suspended and will be played at a later date that will be decided soon.

Article Title: Mass carnage: Clashes at a football match in Guinea leaves dozens dead
Article Text:
Represetational image (Reuters Photo)

Clashes erupted at a football match in N'Zerekore , Guinea , on Sunday, leaving many dead.According to hospital sources quoted by AFP, "There are bodies lined up as far as the eye can see in the hospital. Others are lying on the floor in the hallways. The morgue is full.""There are around 100 dead", said one doctor, while another said there were "dozens of dead".According to witnesses, the anger was fueled by a referee's decision that was contested, after which the fans invaded the pitch and later also set the N'Zerekore police station on fire.Media reports indicated that the game was organised as part of a tournament dedicated to Guinea's current president and junta chief, Mamadi Doumbouya , who took control through a coup in 2021.In Guinea, these tournaments have become increasingly prevalent as Doumbouya appears to be positioning himself for the anticipated presidential elections next year, whilst political alignments continue to develop.In September 2021, Doumbouya, then serving as a colonel, led a successful coup against President Alpha Conde. Ironically, Conde had previously appointed Doumbouya to lead an elite unit responsible for protecting the president from such takeovers.Despite international demands and his initial commitment to transfer authority to civilian leadership by December 2024, Doumbouya has since reversed his stance and indicated he will retain power.
Article Summary: Clashes erupted at a football match in N'Zerekore, Guinea, on Sunday, leaving many dead. Media reports indicated that the game was organised as part of a tournament dedicated to Guinea's current president and junta chief, Mamadi Doumbouya.

Article Title: Real Madrid move to second place in La Liga after win over Getafe
Article Text:
Kylian Mbappe (Photo: @realmadrid on X)

'Good attitude again'

MADRID: Spanish champions Real Madrid beat Getafe 2-0 to move second in La Liga on Sunday with Kylian Mbappe finding the net after a difficult week.The French striker has been criticised in recent weeks for his form but after Jude Bellingham opened the scoring from the penalty spot, Mbappe slotted home a well-taken second.Later, Mbappe wasted three other big chances but Madrid were able to move within one point of league leaders Barcelona, who lost on Saturday at home against Las Palmas.Carlo Ancelotti's side have played one fewer game than the Catalans, and Atletico Madrid, third, who are one point behind."(Mbappe) played very well, he was active, dangerous as always," said Ancelotti. "He scored an important goal, he created chances in the second half and had a very active game, it's what we want from him."Mbappe, playing in his favoured role on the left with Vinicius Junior out injured, was offered plenty of support by Madrid's fans."The fans understand more than anyone what moment the team is in, and the players (are in)," added Ancelotti.Getafe set out to slow the game down and they largely succeeded until Allan Nyom tugged down Antonio Rudiger in the area after half an hour.After Mbappe missed his penalty against Liverpool in the Champions League defeat at Anfield on Wednesday, Bellingham stepped up to take the spot-kick.The England international outfoxed David Soria to send Madrid ahead on the half-hour with his third goal in three league games."Today Bellingham or Mbappe had to choose (who took the penalty), they both chose Bellingham," said Ancelotti.Mbappe doubled his team's lead with a superb strike seven minutes prior to the break, after Bellingham spread the ball out to him on the left flank.The France captain drove inside and curled home a low effort inside the far post for his eighth league goal of the season.Ancelotti took off Bellingham at half-time because of an apparent knock sustained in a collision with Soria, but later said he thought the midfielder would recover quickly.Mbappe produced a glorious chipped pass to put Brahim Diaz in behind early in the second period, but the Morocco international's effort sailed narrowly over the crossbar.The forward came millimetres away from scoring a second himself but after rounding Soria squeezed a shot just wide of the far post.Soria made a good save to deny Fede Valverde as Getafe battled to keep the scoreline respectable.Mbappe spurned another chance to score when he fired off-target after being played in again, but Getafe could not capitalise on his profligacy.John Patrick had the visitors' best chance with a powerful effort which hit the crossbar then the post.Mbappe had another chance in stoppage time but misfired from close range as his anxiety to prove his worth in a Madrid shirt following his summer move from Paris Saint-Germain continued to tell, despite his goal.Madrid face Athletic Bilbao in midweek, hoping to build on their run of three consecutive La Liga wins."We've had a lot of injuries (but) we are there fighting, battling," said Ancelotti. "What gives me the most confidence is that we had a good attitude again, concentration, we had spirit."Bit by bit the problems we've had, we will solve, and in the meanwhile we will be there fighting."
Article Summary: Real Madrid beat Getafe 2-0 to move second in La Liga. French striker Kylian Mbappe scores both goals for Carlo Ancelotti's side. Jude Bellingham opened the scoring from the penalty spot. Madrid move within one point of league leaders Barcelona.

Article Title: Liverpool beat Manchester City for a 9-point lead at top of Premier League
Article Text:
Photo Source: @LFC on X

'A great day'

LIVERPOOL: Liverpool have been used to second best during Pep Guardiola's era at Manchester City , but a 2-0 victory over the crisis-hit champions left little doubt over who are the team to beat in this season's Premier League title race.Goals in either half from Cody Gakpo and Mohamed Salah at Anfield on Sunday did not do justice to the scale of the Reds' domination as City succumbed to a sixth defeat in a seven-game winless run.Arsenal and Chelsea are now Liverpool's closest challengers, nine points behind, with City 11 back and almost certain to finally loose their grip on the English top flight after an unprecedented four consecutive titles and six in the past seven seasons.Guardiola reminded the Anfield crowd of that fact by raising six fingers when taunted with chants of "sacked in the morning".The Catalan's defiance, though, could not mask the fact that City have rested on their laurels, while Liverpool have stepped up a level under Arne Slot.Slot appeared to have the impossible job of succeeding the much-loved Jurgen Klopp.The charismatic German brought Liverpool back to the top of English and Europeanfootball . His title triumph in 2019/2020 was the club's first for 30 years and the only blot on City's dominance in recent times.In contrast to Alex Ferguson's departure from Manchester United and Arsene Wenger's exit at Arsenal, Liverpool have turned a legendary figure leaving into a positive.Klopp did much of the groundwork himself, rejuvenating the squad over his final 18 months in charge with the signings of Gakpo, Alexis Mac Allister, Dominik Szoboszlai and Ryan Gravenberch.Slot's only summer signing, Federico Chiesa, has barely featured due to injury.But the injection of fresh blood, mixed with the experience of title winners in the prolific Salah, captain Virgil van Dijk, Andy Roberson and Trent Alexander-Arnold has proved a winning combination.Slot has been keen to give Klopp's legacy credit, but the Dutchman deserves his due for the small details that have produced a run of 18 wins from his first 20 games in all competitions.Robertson and Alexander-Arnold's narrower positions have left Liverpool less vulnerable in transition and contributed to them having the best defensive record in the league.Gravenberch has shone since being transformed into a holding midfielder, while Gakpo is finally delivering on his potential under his compatriot.Slot has also managed to keep Liverpool's momentum rolling despite constant speculation over the futures of Salah, Van Dijk and Alexander-Arnold, all of whom are out of contract at the end of the season."City are a fantastic team, four times champions in a row and they have quality to punish any team," said Van Dijk. "So, overall, it has been a great day."It's game-by-game and stay calm. But games like this, when you win it like this, is always a good feeling."It is not just the Premier League that Slot has so far bent to his will.Liverpool are also top of the Champions League with a perfect record from five games, including a memorable 2-0 win over Real Madrid on Wednesday.Victory over City capped a dream week, but the former Feyenoord boss was still keen to use the English and European champions as the benchmark for his side's aspirations."Real Madrid and Manchester City have been and are so good, with managers that have won so many trophies, so it is always nice to come out of those situations as a winner," added Slot."But they were able to win every single three days. We understand what we want to achieve is more than this winning once or twice, even against these big teams, if you want to win big things."December may only be a day old, but already it is hard to see beyond Liverpool matching Manchester United's record tally for 20 English top-flight titles come May.
Article Summary: Liverpool beat Manchester City 2-0 in the Premier League on Sunday. Goals from Cody Gakpo and Mohamed Salah secured the win. Arne Slot's side are now nine points clear of Arsenal and Chelsea. The Dutchman has won 18 of his first 20 games in charge of Liverpool.

Article Title: Jude Bellingham, Kylian Mbappe shine as Real Madrid beat Getafe to go second in La Liga
Article Text:
Real Madrid vs Getafe (AP Photos)

NEW DELHI: In a crucial La Liga encounter at the Santiago Bernabeu on Sunday, Real Madrid secured a 2-0 victory over Getafe , propelling them within striking distance of league leaders Barcelona . The match witnessed two significant moments that shaped the outcome.The first pivotal moment came when Real Madrid was awarded a penalty. Jude Bellingham , the young English midfielder, stepped up to take the spot-kick instead of Kylian Mbappe , who had missed a penalty in Real's previous Champions League match against Liverpool.Bellingham displayed composure and precision, sending the ball straight down the middle to give Real Madrid the lead.The second defining moment occurred in the 38th minute when Kylian Mbappe doubled Real Madrid's advantage.The French striker showcased his clinical finishing abilities by expertly converting a brilliant pass from Bellingham, whipping the ball into the net from outside the box. This goal marked Mbappe's 10th across all competitions for Real Madrid this season.With this victory, Real Madrid climbed to second place in the La Liga table, accumulating 33 points from 14 matches.They trail their fierce rivals Barcelona by a single point, although Barcelona has played one game more. On the other hand, Getafe's struggles continued as they remain in 17th place, having collected only 13 points from 15 matches.The match highlighted the attacking acumen of Real Madrid's young talents, Bellingham and Mbappe, who combined effectively to secure the three points.Their contributions were instrumental in keeping Real Madrid's title aspirations alive as they continue to chase Barcelona in the race for the La Liga crown.
Article Summary: Real Madrid secured a 2-0 victory over Getafe at the Santiago Bernabeu. Real Madrid climbed to second place in the La Liga table, accumulating 33 points from 14 matches. They trail their fierce rivals Barcelona by a single point, although Barcelona has played one game more.

Article Title: Chelsea beat Aston Villa 3-0 to move joint second in Premier League
Article Text:
Cole Palmer (Reuters Photo)

NEW DELHI: Striker Nicolas Jackson , the captain Enzo Fernandez , and Cole Palmer showcased their goal-scoring acumen as hosts Chelsea secured a convincing 3-0 victory over Aston Villa at Stamford Bridge on Sunday.This result propelled Chelsea to joint second place in the Premier League table, level on points and goal difference with Arsenal.The opening goal came in the seventh minute when Senegalese striker Jackson displayed his composure by side-footing a cross from Marc Cucurella into the back of the net, with the ball kissing the post on its way in.Chelsea capitalized on Aston Villa's defensive vulnerability in the 36th minute. Palmer's incisive pass found Fernandez, who maintained his composure before firing a well-placed shot between Matty Cash and Ezri Konsa, extending Chelsea's lead.However, it was Palmer who stole the show with an exquisite strike in the 83rd minute.The young midfielder showcased his technical ability by lofting a sublime left-footed effort into the top corner, leaving substitute goalkeeper Robin Olsen with no chance.Enzo Maresca's Chelsea side now finds themselves level on points and goal difference with Arsenal, trailing only Liverpool , who faced Manchester City in the late kickoff.Aston Villa, on the other hand, slipped to 11th position in the league standings.This comprehensive victory not only underscored Chelsea's attacking prowess but also highlighted their ability to capitalize on defensive lapses from their opponents.With the likes of Jackson, Fernandez, and Palmer in fine form, Chelsea's aspirations for a successful campaign have received a significant boost.
Article Summary: Chelsea beat Aston Villa 3-0 at Stamford Bridge on Sunday. Nicolas Jackson, Enzo Fernandez and Cole Palmer scored the goals. Result puts Chelsea level on points and goal difference with Arsenal. Aston Villa slip to 11th in the Premier League table.

Article Title: Manchester United crush Everton in Amorim's first home league game
Article Text: Manchester United achieve a decisive 4-0 win over Everton in Ruben Amorim's first Premier League match at Old Trafford. Marcus Rashford and Joshua Zirkzee each score twice, propelling United to ninth place in the league table, while Everton struggle near the relegation zone.
Article Summary: Manchester United beat Everton 4-0 in Ruben Amorim's first Premier League match at Old Trafford. Marcus Rashford and Joshua Zirkzee each score twice. United move up to ninth place in the league table, while Everton struggle near the relegation zone.

Article Title: Botafogo clinch historic Copa Libertadores title with 3-1 victory over Atletico Mineiro
Article Text:
Botafogo's Luiz Henrique celebrates with the trophy after winning the Copa Libertadores. (Reuters Photo)

Ten-man Botafogo secured their first-ever Copa Libertadores title with a 3-1 win against fellow Brazilian side Atletico Mineiro at River Plate's Monumental Stadium in Buenos Aires on Saturday.Botafogo played with ten men for almost the entire game, following Gregore's red card in the opening minute. Despite this, they displayed remarkable resilience and spirit to claim the victory.Gregore's dismissal came after a high, reckless challenge on Fauto Vera. This forced Botafogo to adapt their strategy. Atletico Mineiro, however, struggled to capitalize on their numerical advantage.Veteran striker Hulk had a shot from distance saved by Botafogo's goalkeeper, John. The Belo Horizonte team generated minimal pressure.Botafogo, sensing an opportunity, started to push forward. Their attacking intent paid off in the 35th minute.Marlon Freitas's shot from the edge of the penalty area deflected around the crowded box. The ball eventually landed at the feet of Luiz Henrique , who scored from close range.Botafogo didn't become defensive after taking the lead. They continued to press and doubled their advantage shortly before halftime.Atletico defender Guilherme Arana attempted to play the ball back to his goalkeeper, Everson. Luiz Henrique intercepted the pass and was brought down by the goalkeeper. Following a VAR review, the referee awarded a penalty. Alex Telles confidently converted the spot-kick, giving Botafogo a surprising 2-0 lead at the break.Atletico, the 2013 Libertadores champions, made three substitutions at halftime. The changes had an immediate impact as Eduardo Vargas scored with a header from a corner kick.Atletico applied late pressure in an attempt to equalize. Botafogo, however, sealed the win with a counter-attacking goal from Junior Santos in stoppage time.Botafogo's victory secures them the last of the 32 spots in next year's FIFA Club World Cup . The tournament will be hosted in the United States.
Article Summary: Botafogo secured their first-ever Copa Libertadores title with a 3-1 win against fellow Brazilian side Atletico Mineiro at River Plate's Monumental Stadium in Buenos Aires on Saturday. Botafogo played with ten men for almost the entire game, following Gregore's red card in the opening minute.

Article Title: Premier League: Arsenal thrash West Ham in seven-goal thriller to climb to second
Article Text:
Arsenal's Martin Odegaard scores their third goal from the penalty spot. (Reuters Photo)

Other EPL results of the day

Brentford cruised to a 4-1 victory over Leicester City, with Kevin Schade netting a hat-trick. New Leicester manager Ruud van Nistelrooy watched from the stands as his side fell to their seventh defeat of the season.

Bournemouth secured a thrilling 4-2 win at Wolverhampton Wanderers, with Justin Kluivert making history as the first player to score a hat-trick of penalties in the Premier League.

Nottingham Forest edged Ipswich Town 1-0, thanks to Chris Wood’s penalty, which also made him the club’s joint-top scorer in the Premier League with 24 goals.

Crystal Palace rescued a 1-1 draw at home to Newcastle United, with Daniel Munoz heading in a stoppage-time equalizer after Marc Guehi’s own goal had put the visitors ahead.

Blockbuster Sunday

Arsenal delivered a stunning attacking display to defeat West Ham United 5-2 at the London Stadium on Saturday, climbing to second place in the Premier League table. The first half was a spectacle, with all seven goals scored before the break, as Mikel Arteta 's side made a resounding statement in the title race.The Gunners, who struggled earlier this month with a four-match winless run, appear to have rediscovered their form, scoring 13 goals in their last three matches. With captain Martin Odegaard back in the lineup, Arsenal looked unstoppable, combining sharp attacking moves with a clinical edge in front of goal.Bukayo Saka set the tone with an assist from a corner that Gabriel Magalhães headed in after nine minutes. Leandro Trossard doubled the lead before Odegaard converted from the penalty spot after Saka was fouled. Moments later, Trossard set up Kai Havertz to make it 4-0.West Ham fought back through Aaron Wan-Bissaka and a sensational free kick from Emerson Palmieri, briefly rattling Arsenal. However, Saka restored calm, slotting home a penalty after Lukasz Fabianski fouled Gabriel in a crowded area.Arteta described the opening period as "spectacular," adding that the fifth goal allowed his team to control the game and play at their pace. Arsenal now have 25 points, six behind league leaders Liverpool.The focus now shifts to Sunday, where Liverpool host Manchester City in a top-of-the-table clash that could see the Reds extend their lead to 11 points. Chelsea, Manchester United , and Tottenham Hotspur are also in action as the weekend promises more drama in the Premier League.
Article Summary: Arsenal beat West Ham 5-2 at the London Stadium. Justin Kluivert scores a hat- trick in Bournemouth's 4-2 win over Leicester. Liverpool host Manchester City in the Premier League on Sunday. Click here for all the latest Premier League news.

Article Title: Italy to host Davis Cup Final 8 from 2025
Article Text: NEW DELHI: The International Tennis Federation (ITF) has announced that Italy will be the host nation for the Davis Cup Final 8 from 2025 through 2027.Italy, led by Jannik Sinner , claimed victory in this year's competition, which concluded in Spain in November. The tournament, previously held in Malaga since 2022, will see a change of venue.ITF president David Haggerty stated: "We are delighted to partner with the FITP (Italian tennis federation) for the Davis Cup Final 8." He further noted: "Italy has a rich history in tennis and a proven ability to host world-class sporting events."Bologna has been selected as the venue for the 2025 competition.FITP president Angelo Binaghi expressed his enthusiasm: "We are thrilled to have been selected as hosts and look forward to welcoming the best teams in the world to our country next November and for the next three years."The ITF also revealed the 2025 Davis Cup qualifiers ' first-round draw. Italy receives automatic qualification to the Final 8, whilst the Netherlands, 2024's runners-up, will enter in the second round.The opening round will see 26 teams competing across 13 ties, scheduled for either January 31, 2025 to February 1, or February 1 to February 2.The format includes two singles matches on the first day, followed by a doubles match and two singles matches on the second day.Successful teams from these 13 ties will progress to September's second qualifying round.Key matchups include Sweden versus Australia, France against Brazil, and Britain facing Japan.
Article Summary: Italy will host the Davis Cup Final 8 from 2025 through 2027. The tournament, previously held in Malaga since 2022, will see a change of venue. Bologna has been selected as the venue for the 2025 competition. The ITF also revealed the 2025 Davis Cup qualifiers'first-round draw.

Article Title: I can still play at the highest level, says Novak Djokovic
Article Text: Novak Djokovic is set to tackle emerging tennis stars, Jannik Sinner and Carlos Alcaraz, as he returns to the Australian Open in 2025. After a challenging 2024, where he missed winning any major titles, Djokovic aims to reclaim his dominance. With Andy Murray joining as a coach, Djokovic is focused on Grand Slams and expanding his tournament schedule.
Article Summary: Novak Djokovic is set to return to the Australian Open in 2025. The Serb missed out on any major titles in 2024. Andy Murray has joined Djokovich as a coach. The Serbian is looking to reclaim his dominance in the sport.

Article Title: I believe I belong on the Tour: Sumit Nagal
Article Text: Sumit Nagal, ranking as India's No.1 tennis player at age 27, highlights the importance of self-belief. Despite challenges such as injuries and being relatively shorter in stature, Nagal impressively broke into the top-100 this year. His mental fortitude remains crucial as he prepares for the 2025 season, with a growing ambition to maintain his presence on the Tour.
Article Summary: Sumit Nagal broke into the top-100 this year. The 27-year-old is India's No.1 tennis player at age 27. Nagal has a growing ambition to maintain his presence on the Tour. He is currently ranked No.99 in the world.

Article Title: 'The injustice to me was painful': Simona Halep slams ITIA's double standards after Iga Swiatek's one-month ban
Article Text:
Iga Swiatek and Simona Halep (Agency Photos)

NEW DELHI: Former world number one tennis player from Romania Simona Halep has raised concerns about the perceived discrepancies in the treatment of cases involving positive tests for banned substances by the International Tennis Integrity Agency ( ITIA ).Her criticism stems from the recent one-month ban imposed on Iga Swiatek , the current world number two, after testing positive for the heart medication trimetazidine (TMZ) in an out-of-competition sample.Halep, who returned to tennis in March 2023 after serving a provisional suspension since October 2022 for testing positive for roxadustat at the US Open, believes there is a lack of consistency in the ITIA's approach.She questions the significant difference in the penalties handed out to her and Swiatek, despite the cases occurring around the same time.In her statement, Halep expressed her bewilderment at the disparate treatment and questioned the logical reasoning behind the ITIA's decisions. She accused the organization of attempting to "destroy" her career, despite the evidence presented, and claimed to have suffered from the perceived injustice.“I have always believed in good, I have believed in the fairness of this sport, I have believed in kindness," Halep wrote on Instagram. “The injustice that was done to me was painful, is painful and maybe will always be painful. How is it possible that in identical cases that happened at about the same time (of the season), ITIA has completely different approaches, to my detriment?”Halep had initially received a four-year ban from the ITIA, which she successfully appealed at the Court of Arbitration for Sport (CAS) in February 2023. The CAS ruled that her positive test for roxadustat, a banned blood doping agent, was the result of a contaminated supplement.Her experience has raised concerns about the fairness and impartiality of the disciplinary process within the tennis governing bodies.
Article Summary: Former world number one tennis player Simona Halep has raised concerns about the perceived discrepancies in the treatment of positive tests by the ITIA. Her criticism stems from the recent one-month ban imposed on Iga Swiatek after testing positive for the heart medication trimetazidine (TMZ) in an out-of- competition sample.
